metadata.title: CVE-2020-10933 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Ruby 2.5.x through 2.5.7, 2.6.x through 2.6.5,and 2.7.0. If a victim calls BasicSocket#read_nonblock(requested_size,buffer, exception: false), the method resizes the buffer to fit therequested size, but no data is copied. Thus, the buffer string provides theprevious value of the heap. This may expose possibly sensitive data fromthe interpreter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10933` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.7 - 2.7.0-5ubuntu1.3
ruby2.7 - 2.7.0-5ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby2.7 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.0-5ubuntu1.3').
